doc.abstracts: Benin loses 52 billion FCFA annually, which is equivalent to 104 million USD, according to a documentary survey made by the Water and Sanitation Program. This amount is equivalent to 12 USD per person in Benin for a year, or 1.5 percent of national GDP. 2.5 million Beninese use unhygienic or shared latrines. 5.2 million have no latrines at all and defecate outdoors. The poorest quintile is 25 times more likely to practice open defecation than the richest. The cost of open defecation in Benin is more than $ 75 million per year - yet the elimination of this practice would involve the construction and use of less than 1 million latrines.
